item.title: Outlier Detection in Air Pollution Data
item.description: Introduction On a daily basis, economical, technological and political changes cause air pollution, which is currently one of the most pressing environmental issues around the globe. It is particularly acute in large cities with the rising level of industrialization and growing urbanization. The polluted air we breathe results in serious health disorders and decreases the quality of life. Before steps are taken to decrease the harmful effect of daily produced pollutants, certain measurements are required.
